title: 2-sphere potential set - compare V at I and II

content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the relationship between the electric potentials <math alttext="V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> at points <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="V sub 1 equals V sub 2, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, V sub 1 equals V sub 2, close parenthesis, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="V sub 1 is less than V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="V sub 1 is greater than V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V sub 1 equals V sub 2, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
